ngiemboon: Pi júʼu mmó gie á ka gÿo n gyá ngie n te gíŋ piŋe láʼ pi, é gÿo pi gíŋ ḿmÿɔg wɔ́,
en: In fact, I made up my mind about this: I would not come to you on another painful visit.

ngiemboon: á nue n dɔɔn ńgÿo pi mÿɔg, mbà pà wɔ̌ ge piŋ gÿo ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn kág tà á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅí gẅie n zɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pi mÿɔg wɔ́ɔ?
en: For if I cause you pain, then who will cheer me other than the one being hurt by me?

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo n ŋweʼe pɔ́ ŋwàʼne ńnáa mbwó pi, á na ntí gie n ka ŋweʼe la. N ka te ne ńkwoŋo lé leen ńtóo láʼ pi, ńgyá pʉ̀a pɔ́ gÿo n gẅiin lemÿɔ̀g tá mbà pɔ́ kɔʼɔ́ gÿo ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn kág kág wɔ́. N ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie n dɔɔn ne ńkága, mbà pi ge kág gí.
en: I wrote this very thing so that when I came I wouldn’t have pain from those who ought to give me joy, because I am confident   about all of you that my joy will also be yours.

ngiemboon: N ka gwaa ŋweʼe ŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́, ńne ńdʉa, letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn ne ńgyáŋa tɛʼ, mbùm yɔ̀ɔn ne ńtsyɛte, táʼ, n kɔ̌ɔn ńké těen ńŋweʼe ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo ngie pi mÿɔg wɔ́. N kɔ̌ɔn ńŋweʼe púʼu, pɔ́ lélɔg ńnyɛɛ gẅí máamáa nkwòŋe gie n gẅiin nzèm pi.
en: For I wrote to you with many tears out of an extremely troubled and anguished heart #— #not to cause you pain, but that you should know the abundant love I have for you.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na nyìŋ gẅie à ka gÿo pi néŋe né lemÿɔ̀g, mbà à ka te gÿo pɔ́ na mèŋ wɔ́, à ka gÿo pɔ́ na pi metsèm. Ndyɛ̀ʼ mbà á ka te na pi metsèm wɔ́, táʼ, á ka kě ńgwɔ́ na lelÿò pʉ̀a.
en: If anyone has caused pain, he has caused pain not so much to me but to some degree #— #not to exaggerate    #— #to all of you.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a ké ńkaga yé, á kuʼ púʼu.
en: This punishment by the majority is sufficient for that person.

ngiemboon: Tà á ne ńzɛ́te fʉ̀ʼɔɔn pɔ́ ngie pi lege ńnáa mbwó yé, ńtóonte yé, ḿbɔ́g páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, á mÿɔg sésag, ńkʉ́a.
en: As a result, you should instead forgive   and comfort him. Otherwise, he may be overwhelmed by excessive grief.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi gÿo na ntí gie à ge zsé ngie pi nyě ńkwoŋo yé kwoŋ.
en: Therefore I urge you to reaffirm your love to him.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie n ka gǐŋ ńgwaa ŋweʼe ŋwàʼne é náa mbwó pi, ńne faʼa lélʉŋte gẅí ńgyá, kà pi kuʼu léjúʼ ncwò na menò ntsèm wɔ́ɔ.
en: I wrote for this purpose: to test your character   to see if you are obedient  # 2:9 Php 2:8 in everything.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdege mefʉa nyìŋ ńnáa mbwó yé, mbà n degé yɔ́ɔn ńnáa mbwó ngàŋ. Ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn ńgẅiin lélege mefʉa nyìŋ, ńdege, mbà n tyé mvfò Keleto ńdege púʼu pɔ́ lélɔg ńkẅéte gẅí,
en: Anyone you forgive, I do too. For what I have forgiven #— #if I have forgiven anything #— #it is for your benefit in the presence of Christ,

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pege te nyé Sátà cʉa wégè wɔ́, á nue pege te ne ḿmoŋe mmó gie aa nzèm pege, éfaʼa wɔ́.
en: so that we may not be taken advantage   of by Satan. For we are not ignorant of his schemes.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na wɔ̀ɔn legìŋ ŋwɛ́, mbà n da kúu tÿǒsoŋo Tolowásè létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Keleto wó, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɛ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ mánzsè mbwó mèŋ léfaʼa fàʼ yé,
en: When I came to Troas   to preach the gospel of Christ, even though the Lord opened a door  # 2:12 Col 4:3 for me,

ngiemboon: táʼ, kékʉ́b wɔ̀ɔn ké ne ńtsɔ́ʼɔ tsɔʼɔ́, mélàʼmie n da te fɛ̌ wege Titúsè wó gyá. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo n deʼe pʉ̀a Tolowásè, ńgʉa né Masenduwane léfaʼa yé.
en: I had no rest   in my spirit because I did not find my brother Titus.  # 2:13 Ti 1:4 Instead, I said good-bye to them and left for Macedonia.  # 2:13 Ac 16:9

ngiemboon: Táʼ, peg ge ké ná pɔ́ ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ńtí nue aa fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ńne ńgÿo peg gwɔ́ pɔ́ na mánzòŋ Keleto, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lekág, mbà yé Keleto jÿǒ ncù. Yé Ssé lɔgɔ wég ńgÿo mé zsé Keleto jʉʼ ntsèm, páʼ mmó gie mé túɔ, agyě kwɔ́ʼɔ ésa jʉʼ ntsèm la.
en: But thanks be to God,   who always leads us in Christ’s triumphal procession and through us spreads the aroma of the knowledge of him in every place.  # 2:14 Jn 17:3; 1Jn 4:8

ngiemboon: Peg zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbwó Ssé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ gyě mmó mbòŋo gie á fóo mbwó Keleto. Á gyě gie á kwɔ́ʼ ńtéme mezẅé pʉ̀a, á mezẅé pʉ̀a pie ée na mánzsè we letsẅɛ́, tà mbɔɔ na mé pʉ̀a pie é ne ḿbyé.
en: For to God we are the fragrance   of Christ among those who are being saved  # 2:15 Mt 9:22; Ac 16:30; Eph 2:8 and among those who are perishing.  # 2:15 Jn 6:27

ngiemboon: Ayɛ̌ gyě áa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne ḿbyé ńgwɔ́ gyě gie á náa legwé, ńgwɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne ńtsẅɛ́ɛ, ńgwɔ́ gyě legwɔ́ wó gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó. Tà áa páʼɔɔn, ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ kuʼu légwɔ́ mmó gie mé ge lɔg faʼa yɔɔn fàʼ?
en: To some we are an aroma of death   leading to death, but to others, an aroma of life  # 2:16 1Jn 5:12 leading to life. Who is adequate for these things?

ngiemboon: Táʼ, peg te páʼ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie é lɔgɔ shwóŋè Ssé ńgÿo sɔ́b shúm metʉ̌a wɔ́, peg shwóŋ yég pɔ́ né ntʉ́m Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie Ssé ka tǔm. Peg gwaa shwóŋ, e Ssé ne ńgyá wég, peg piŋ ńda nnɛ́ na Keleto.
en: For we do not market the word of God   for profit like so many.  # 2:17 Other mss read like the rest On the contrary, we speak with sincerity in Christ, as from God and before God.
